page.title: 11HOME LIFE IN FORDYCE AREA
page.content:
A Day in the Life of a School Child
At 7.30 a.m. I rise,wash,brush my teeth and have breakfast of cereal,tea and rolls.When I have everything I need for school,I cycle to the bus at 8.25.On arrival at school,we chat in our room till lessons start at 9.When interval comes,we rush to our Tuck shop to buy crisps or juice and spend the rest of the time playing Hide and Seek or Under arm Tacky.We have specialists who help in Gymnastics, Music and Handwork.School lunch is provided at 12.30 p.m.,as only village pupils can manage home.We have lessons again from 1.30 till 3.30,when we finish for the day.When I reach home, I feed my cats and attend to my horse before I have tea at 5p.m.
.
